thread.title: Union Pacific freight train derails in Texas
thread.title_full: Union Pacific freight train derails in Texas | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: Union Pacific freight train derails in Texas
text:
Oct 24 A Union Pacific freight train derailed in southeast Texas early Saturday morning as flood waters covered the tracks about 55 miles south of Dallas, putting a locomotive and rail cars on their side, according to a company spokesman and TV footage.
The two crew members operating the train swam to safety after the derailment, Jeff DeGraff, a Union Pacific Railroad spokesman, told CNN.
"This train was carrying cement, which is not hazardous material," DeGraff said. "We are keeping an eye out for diesel."
(Reporting By Frank McGurty; Editing by Andrew Heavens )
